channel.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
channel.description:
Hi there.
im trying to make a server, and belive it or not i have been sitting here on this forum and sythe's and looking all around for tutorials and i found some good ones but all of them got different answers. Now, my question is: Where do i download like JDK 6 update 5? All i can find is JDK 6 update 16, and that dosnt seems 2 work. ive done all path's and classpath's, opened my ports and so on and still it dosnt work. i also have right clicked on different source's compilers and tried 2 edit them with
[code]@echo off title Server Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/code]
Please help me, i really want to get this done, thank you so much. and btw, when im done with it im going 2 need co-owners and so on so just add my msn: nima.edalat@hotmail.com if your intrested. but start off with helping plz, thankz :)

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @nimoo nimoo
item.description:
@nimoo wrote:

Oh ok, but what i have heard i have to like search for the ip of the server and then replace that with mine or something?

EDIT i went into gui.java file and changed the ip to mine.
I fixed the compiler’s and when i run the server it says its online, and when i log in it works fine…
But when my friend is trying to log in it aint working?
I got a wireless connection to a router. I’ve opened all my ports (43594) and still dosn’t work?

really need this server, please help me <33

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @iKilem iKilem
item.description:
@iKilem wrote:

You want to change the port your server listens on? Your original post didn’t exactly make that clear…

Ok, open up server.java and search for

new ServerSocket(43594);

Change 43594 to whatever port number you want to listen on.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @nimoo nimoo
item.description:
@nimoo wrote:

Lol okay, guys how about the run.bat??? What should i edit in that file.
Like how do i change the ports the server has, because some of them got different ones. i got the default.
And so on, please explain :)<33

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?

item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

Most of the time that won’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Telenim, post:13, topic:311332”]A bit different, here is what I would use for jdk1.6.0_14

@echo off title Server Running "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\java.exe" server pause
So, you understand how changing what JDK is used then you would have no problems with it if you have a different version.[/quote]

Or simply just:

@echo off
java -Xmx800M server
pause

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

A bit different, here is what I would use for jdk1.6.0_14

@echo off title Server Running "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\java.exe" server pause

So, you understand how changing what JDK is used then you would have no problems with it if you have a different version.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @nimoo nimoo
item.description:
@nimoo wrote:

[quote=“Telenim, post:11, topic:311332”]You can’t open ports for compiling
JDK 6u14+ is recommended.
If you have JDK 6u16 you would use something like this

@echo off title Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
If you have JDK 6u15 you would use something like this

@echo off title Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
If you have JDK 6u14 you wouuld use something like this

@echo off title Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

OK, you may have noticed the difference, in the line “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe” *.java

The only parts that change is the jdk1.6.0_14 bits, because that’s the version it’s going to use, and you need to have it downloaded and installed properly.[/quote]

oh ok, ya i get that but how about the ‘‘run’’ what should be in there? ^^. Like i dont get those parts, and no tuts says theese things.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

You can’t open ports for compiling
JDK 6u14+ is recommended.
If you have JDK 6u16 you would use something like this

@echo off title Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
If you have JDK 6u15 you would use something like this

@echo off title Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
If you have JDK 6u14 you wouuld use something like this

@echo off title Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

OK, you may have noticed the difference, in the line “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe” *.java

The only parts that change is the jdk1.6.0_14 bits, because that’s the version it’s going to use, and you need to have it downloaded and installed properly.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?

item.description:
@nimoo wrote:

And what should i edit in the run.bat?

item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

jdk 14: even more simple:

@echo off javac *.java pause

item.title: JDK ( Java ) Downloads?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

16 works fine for me.

My compiler: (Nice & Simple)

@echo off
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

Read full topic
